main_destination.name: São Tomé and Príncipe
main_destination.description: This island nation offers a secluded and romantic escape with stunning beaches, lush rainforests perfect for hiking, and a rich colonial history. It avoids the crowds of typical tourist destinations and provides opportunities for sustainable tourism. The warm weather, delicious local cuisine (focused on fresh seafood), and potential for all-inclusive resorts make it ideal for a relaxing yet adventurous cultural experience. It's also considered safe for tourists.

places_of_interest.name: Obo National Park
places_of_interest.description: Explore the diverse rainforest ecosystem, hike to waterfalls, and spot unique bird species.

places_of_interest.name: Roças (Plantations)
places_of_interest.description: Visit former cocoa and coffee plantations to learn about the islands' colonial history and architecture. Some have been converted into hotels.

places_of_interest.name: Pico Grande
places_of_interest.description: Hike to the iconic volcanic plug for breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape.

places_of_interest.name: Praia Banana
places_of_interest.description: Relax on the pristine sands of this secluded beach, known for its crystal-clear waters.

alternative_destinations.name: Dominica
alternative_destinations.reason: Similar to São Tomé and Príncipe, Dominica offers lush rainforests, hiking trails, waterfalls, and fewer crowds than other Caribbean islands. It's also focused on eco-tourism.

alternative_destinations.name: The Azores, Portugal
alternative_destinations.reason: These Portuguese islands offer stunning volcanic landscapes, hiking opportunities, whale watching, and a unique cultural experience. They are less crowded than mainland Portugal and offer a good balance of relaxation and adventure.

travel_tips: Learn a few basic Portuguese phrases, as it's the official language.
Pack light clothing, swimwear, hiking shoes, and insect repellent.
Book accommodations and tours in advance, especially during peak season (though traveling outside peak season is preferred).
Be prepared for limited internet access in some areas.
Respect the local culture and environment by practicing responsible tourism.
